lexUnit.name: mind-numbing.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: causing a state of mental exhaustion

sentence.text: The judges could complicate matters by ordering that the outcome of the deals be reversed , necessitating a mind-numbing series of calculations by the City .
The greenhouse effect is deeply in danger of being Branaghed largely because of the mind-numbing saturation with which it is being covered .
The bottom is reached with a mind-numbing crash that jars every bone , but at least this thaws out my brain .
COMPUTERS are ideal for boring , repetitive and mind-numbing tasks -- which makes you wonder why there is n't any artificial intelligence Christmas list-making software on the market .
A surprise attack is a superb card to have up your sleeve , especially when you combine it with a mind-numbing yell and a distracting dummy movement .

Attention was switching to continental groups such as the Italian ` autonomists " , who rejected the fruitless and mind-numbing discipline and line-toeing demanded by the other builders of the New Revolution .
If you care , then watch some people on WITHOUT WALLS go on about these topics at great and possibly mind-numbing length .
Castle Drachenfels could provide a mind-numbing complication to add to the events of Empire in Flames .
The claws thrust directly into his body and cause an agonizing pain and mind-numbing fear .
We went round in the same circles for half an hour and I left feeling a mind-numbing frustration , far worse than anything induced by meetings with the Foreign Office .
The guards on duty seemed to resent his intrusion since his presence would require them to put away the magazines , turn off the portable TVs and spend a mind-numbing morning staring at the ceiling .
I explained at mind-numbing length about communicating with other users through bulletin boards , about capturing free software programs over the phone lines , and about game-playing via modems .

Under normal circumstances , Stephen would have left Flyte out -- any encounter with him inevitably led to conversations of mind-numbing tedium -- but resistance everywhere else left him with no option .
Her mouth opened to scream for help , but the sound emerged as a strangled groan as she realised the mind-numbing truth .
Beyond seven feet or so , nothing except mind-numbing depth .
The ` development community " spouts a mind-numbing new vocabulary to obscure the disturbing -- often unmanagable -- reality it faces .
The longest came from his great rival , William Ewart Gladstone -- that clocked in at a mind-numbing four hours and 45 minutes .
